abstract: Even with regulation, some federally insured banks say they will continue to make bets using their own money on behalf of clients.
snippet: Even with regulation, some federally insured banks say they will continue to make bets using their own money on behalf of clients.
lead_paragraph: When Congress passed a new financial regulation bill last month, it sought to prevent federally insured banks from making speculative bets using their own money. But that will not stop banks from making bets that some critics deem risky, even as the rules go into effect over the next few years.

headline.main: Despite Reform, Banks Have Room for Risky Deals
headline.print_headline: Despite Reform, Banks Have Room For Risky Deals

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

byline.original: By Nelson D. Schwartz and Eric Dash
